ygData.subject: Weapons Ratios
ygData.msgSnippet: For those of you who ponder the effectiveness of weapons. EQ lize just put up a nice 1HS and 2HS ratios section on their site
ygData.messageBody:
For those of you who ponder the effectiveness of weapons. EQ'lize just put
up a nice 1HS and 2HS ratios section on their site


http://gameznet.com/eq/equipment/1hweaponcomparisons.html


Bernwyn
My mistake it was not a Blackened Iron Crown
but a Black Ironed Gown +5 cha because of the crisp seams.


----- Original Message -----
From: Jesse <j@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, July 22, 1999 10:31 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Blackened Iron Armor *SPOILER* (sort of)


> From: Jesse <j@...>
>
>
> > > And what if that person that retired their main character, who got
that
> > > rubicite? Should they just delete that character and lose the
rubicite?
> > > How are they depriving anyone else?
> >
> > > I think it's quite clear that simply twinking a character and CAMPING
for
> > > items to twink another char are quite different.
> >
> > But these are indistinguishable. Given a symptom that has a
> > neutral cause and a negative cause, you are going to share in
> > the misery handed out by those bitter about the negative
> > cause.
>
> They're indistinguishable to you. What business is it of yours? None.
>
> If there's a symptom of something that has a GOOD cause (prevents me from
> going and camping with my new character all over again) and a negative
> cause, YOU may share in the misery, but I won't. Not once have I felt any
> pain due to a twinked person.
>
> > I've had friends do the same thing as you. But I daresay,
> > most twinked characters are secondary (or third, or fourth,
> > etc) characters made by players who want to build up a
> > different class/character quickly, with little regard for all
> > the toes they'll be stepping on on the way.
>
> Oh yes, look at all those toes I stepped on by not camping for tomahawks..
> oh my god. I guess I better go camp those items (with my new char), making
> everyone wait longer and the game less and less fun for everyone.
>
> > > Please don't automatically associate all the evils of camping rares to
> > > twink newbies with simply twinking.
> >
> > The alternative is to ignore the evils. Rock and hard place.
> > Most people choose to shoot the occasional innocent rather
> > than let the bad guy get away with it.
>
> The alternative is to stop crying and whining over things that are most
> likely not hurting you and most likely do more good than harm.
>
> Your choice seems to be to shoot all the innocents just in case there's a
> bad guy in there. What an honorable decision, yes, you shot the bad guys..
> nevermind those people who are actually making the situation better.
>
> ---
> Jesse <j@...>
> http://www.lumiere.net/
>
>
